intro: Licaria clarensis, commonly known as the Clarens licaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
